alert.note: Alert for Brown (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 9:49AM CDT until April 25 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County. Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. .Overnight heavy rainfall will cause Cottonwood River to reenter minor flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River at New Ulm. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.1 feet, Flood waters begin to impact Cottonwood Street west of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 AM CDT Thursday, the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 12.2 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 03/30/1960. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
